org.presentation.persistence.integration

Interface CheckupDAO

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CheckupDAOImpl

    public interface CheckupDAO
    CheckupDAO interface that serves as layer between business persistence facade and persistence context.
    Author:
    radio.koza

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int countUserChecks(String email)
      Method counts Checkup objects assigned to user with specified email.
      void create(Checkup checkup)
      Method persists new Checkup in database.
      Checkup find(Integer checkupId)
      Method finds instance of Checkup in database by its primary key.
      List<Checkup> findAllUserChecks(String email)
      Method returns collection of Checkup objects assigned to the user with specified email address.
      List<Checkup> findAllUserChecks(String email, int offset, int count)
      Method has the same functionality as findAllUserChecks(java.lang.String) but moreover it is possible to filter results by its starting index position and wanted results count.
      List<Checkup> findAllWithState(CheckState[] states)
      Method finds all Checkup objects with one of specified states passed in parameter.
      void flush()
      Method flushes persistence context to database.
      void update(Checkup checkup)
      Method updates attributes of the specified Checkup.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        void create(Checkup checkup)
        Method persists new Checkup in database. Note that user of the checkup must be specified in order to successful persist data to database.
        Parameters:
        checkup - New Checkup instance to be persisted to database

      • update

        void update(Checkup checkup)
        Method updates attributes of the specified Checkup. Note that this method should not be used to edit collections in checkup (eg. domains, headers, etc...).
        Parameters:
        checkup - Checkup which should be updated in database

      • find

        Checkup find(Integer checkupId)
        Method finds instance of Checkup in database by its primary key.
        Parameters:
        checkupId - Primary key of the checkup which is going to be searched
        Returns:
        Instance of Checkup if found; null if checkup with specified primary key does not exist in database

      • findAllUserChecks

        List<Checkup> findAllUserChecks(String email)
        Method returns collection of Checkup objects assigned to the user with specified email address.
        Parameters:
        email - Email of the user whose checkups should be found
        Returns:
        List of Checkup instances assigned to user with specified email; collection could be empty if no such Checkup exists; never returns null

      • findAllUserChecks

        List<Checkup> findAllUserChecks(String email,
                                int offset,
                                int count)
        Method has the same functionality as findAllUserChecks(java.lang.String) but moreover it is possible to filter results by its starting index position and wanted results count. This method is used for purposes of paginator.
        Parameters:
        email - Email of the user whose checkups should be found
        offset - Index of the Checkup to limit query by
        count - Count of wanted results.
        Returns:
        List of Checkup instances matching filter with List.size() <= count.

      • findAllWithState

        List<Checkup> findAllWithState(CheckState[] states)
        Method finds all Checkup objects with one of specified states passed in parameter.
        Parameters:
        states - Array of states to be applied as filter
        Returns:
        List of Checkup matching the filter

      • flush

        void flush()
        Method flushes persistence context to database. This is useful when it is necessary to assign primary keys to newly created entity classes and then use the primary keys in the single transaction.

      • countUserChecks

        int countUserChecks(String email)
        Method counts Checkup objects assigned to user with specified email.
        Parameters:
        email - Email of the user whose checkups should be counted.
        Returns:
        Count of user's checkups
